topic: Journaling for Parents: Documenting Family Life

dialog.text: Why bother journaling our family life when we already have photos and busy days?
dialog.instructions: Warm, curious, intimate; steady pace; sincere tone.

dialog.text: Journaling isn't about perfect memory; it's about training your eyes to notice what truly matters.
But won't the small moments fade as life speeds up?
When I started with one line a day, those tiny moments stitched into the story of us.
Okay, what should I write today?
dialog.instructions: Curious, ready to start; light-hearted tone.

dialog.text: Just one line: what you noticed, what surprised you, and what you want to rememberâ€”no pressure to be perfect.
Try journaling that single line today, and share a moment in the comments so others can reflect on what's worth remembering.
dialog.instructions: Motivating, inviting, uplifting; slightly brighter tone.
